content: in this episode we will make very durable trees using no armatures and no
static grass Scottie and many others have done videos
on how to make homemade flocking here's a quick recap take your color of choice
cheap matte acrylic paint mix it 50/50 with water and then gradually add
sawdust mixing it in and keep adding until it's no longer a wet paste but
more like a damp crumbly texture then spread it out to dry for about 24 hours
at this point you'll have a very coarse flocking and most tutorials will tell
you to get a sugar strainer and grind this stuff through it to get your nice
typical fine grass flocking however for these trees don't do that just stop here
okay here's a packing insert of polystyrene I'm just going to break off
chunks from it about 3/4 inch across you can use anything for the trunk a pencil
I've used the handles of spent foam brushes what you see here is a stick
from my backyard so we'll just hot glue these foam chunks
to the trunk so that the canopy of the tree is the shape that we want
now I'm going to base the canopy with the same color that my flock is or at
least something real close to it and this is optional at a black wash to
it I did this to help cover up the really deep nooks and crannies that I
might have missed with my base coat okay undiluted solid coat of white glue
and apply that course flocking let it dry overnight and then we're
going to coat the entire thing with the sealant mixture we talked about back in
episode 38 two-thirds white PVA glue one-third water this might take a full
day or two to dry but after it does the whole thing will feel like concrete and
I'll take some lime green just going to dry brush this on to get some real nice
highlights on the leaves all right cut a circular base out of chipboard hot glue
the tree to it paint the base with whatever color your
ground flocking is and then apply white glue a few pebbles
and your grass flocking and here's a few others I did different sizes different
canopy shapes different colors but two on the Left have very thick trunks and
those are what I was talking about those craft foam brushes they're dark grey
foam brushes you can get at the craft store once they're done I just cut the
handle off and I use those as trunks and just for context here they are against
the end that we made back in episode 38 please be good for wargaming or your
role-playing scene and again I like these because there's no armatures and
no static grass involved I am wild Locke thank you for joining me and I'll see
you next time
